title: How to Make Fruit Pops

steps.headline: Start by gathering an assortment of 2-4 different types of washed fruit.
steps.description: You can use whatever fruit you want. Try strawberries, bananas, kiwis, mango, watermelon, cherries, blueberries, grapes or apples.

steps.headline: Slice up all of your fruit into small marble-sized chunks.
Start dropping the chunks of fruit into some clean icy pole moulds.
steps.description: You can find these at kitchen stores or even your local dollar store.

steps.headline: Switch up the fruit, so add some chunks of fruit, and then some chunks of another fruit.
steps.description: Look at the molds from the side to see if you like how it looks.

steps.headline: Keep dropping fruit until it comes about a centimeter from the top.
Get some cool water or sugar-free juice (note: using water helps you to see the colorful fruit better) and pour it in each mold until it reaches the top of the mold.
Stab the plastic Popsicle sticks into each mold  Try to make it stab through some fruit, it will help the Popsicles hold better.
Make sure each stick is tight before you put the molds into the freezer overnight.
There you are!
steps.description: You have have your own super healthy, fruity AND colorful homemade Popsicle  Enjoy outside on the hammock while reading a good book.

text: Start by gathering an assortment of 2-4 different types of washed fruit. You can use whatever fruit you want. Try strawberries, bananas, kiwis, mango, watermelon, cherries, blueberries, grapes or apples. Slice up all of your fruit into small marble-sized chunks.  Start dropping the chunks of fruit into some clean icy pole moulds. You can find these at kitchen stores or even your local dollar store. Switch up the fruit, so add some chunks of fruit, and then some chunks of another fruit. Look at the molds from the side to see if you like how it looks. Keep dropping fruit until it comes about a centimeter from the top.  Get some cool water or sugar-free juice (note: using water helps you to see the colorful fruit better) and pour it in each mold until it reaches the top of the mold.  Stab the plastic Popsicle sticks into each mold  Try to make it stab through some fruit, it will help the Popsicles hold better.  Make sure each stick is tight before you put the molds into the freezer overnight.  There you are! You have have your own super healthy, fruity AND colorful homemade Popsicle  Enjoy outside on the hammock while reading a good book.
